pros:
Can steal skills from Explorer classes
  • Makes for a versatile and very useful class
Has a revive Final Feint
Has a useful Link Skill that provides additional %Crit Chance
Has quite a few mobility skills like Shroud Walk, Rapier Wit and Penombre
cons:
Skills have low base damage but damage is consistent
  • Compensated by utility and attacks quick
  • Base damage as in damage per hit on a skill
    • For example, Mille Aiguilles deals 112% damage (at Max Level) but hits 3 times and super quickly

baseStats: Excludes Hyper Skill Passives and buffs with cooldowns
Dodge Chance: 50%
Crit Rate: +35% + (up to 20% from Link Skill)
Ignore DEF: +30% + (20% from Penombre debuff)

build: -> -> ->

details: Put one SP into each skill first and then max each skill in this order
For any skills that have prerequisites, follow them first before following build path
4th Job skills require Mastery Books to reach Master Level 20 & 30

hyperBuild.recommended:
• Tempest - Reinforce and Cooldown Cutter
  • Mille Aiguilles - Reinforce and Guardbreak
  • Choice of:
    • Tempest - Extra Target
    • Mille Aiguilles - Extra Target
    • Bad Luck Ward - Immunity Enhance

extraContent.title: Explorer Skill Stealing
extraContent.content:
Phantoms can steal the skills of Explorer classes (except Jett/Zen) to copy and use them. Certain skills cannot be stolen and the passive effects of skills do not apply

To steal skills, use the Skill Swipe skill in your beginners tab and search for Explorers to steal from. To manage your stolen skills, open up the Skill Management UI by using the Loadout skill in your beginners tab

primary.desc: Allows you to teleport using the directional keys up to 3 times
details: Cooldown increases based on the number of times you teleported (by 1.5 secs each)

primary.desc: Activates a special UI where you can select and steal skills from nearby Explorer characters
details: Passive effects of stolen skills will not be applied

Skill duration and cooldowns will be the same for Phantom
  • Certain skills may not be stolen and Bishop's Heal's cooldown, if stolen will be longer

primary.desc: Allows you to manage all the skills you have stolen
details: After equipping a stolen skill, there is a short cooldown (30 secs) before you can use it

primary.desc: Releases all the cards in your Card Gauge which seek out and attack one enemy
details:
Phantom has a special gauge that is charged by attacking enemies
  • Once it is full you may use this skill to reset your gauge

You also gain a buff after this skill has been activated:
  • [Destin]: Increases %Crit Rate
  • [Malheur]: Increases %Item Drop Rate
  • [Endurance]: Increases Abnormal Status Resistance and %Elemental Resistance
  • [Drain]: Restore some %Max HP when attacking

primary.desc: When this skill is on Auto, will automatically be used when your Card Gauge is filled
Strikes forward twice
Allows you to use a stolen 1st Job Explorer skill
Double jump skill
details: Can be assigned a Key Slot using or activated by pressing jump twice
Can be used twice in a row
[Passive]: Permanently increases Movement Speed, Jump and Max Movement Speed

primary.desc: Sends out cards that strike forward
Allows you to use a stolen 2nd Job Explorer skill
Launches a blast of cards that pushes enemies back
When you land a critical hit, there is a chance to create a card that seek and attack a nearby enemy
Increases Attack Speed (by 2 stages)
Slices up enemies in front of you
When hit by a fatal attack, you will not die but instead heal back a percentage of your HP back
details: You are briefly invincible after reviving
Not affected by cooldown resets
[Passive]: Permanently grants flat LUK

primary.desc: Grants a chance to dodge attacks
Dashes forward and then strikes forward
details: Can be linked with to reduce post-attack delay
[Passive]: Increases %Damage of

primary.desc: Strikes forward with a flurry of attacks
details: You can move while casting

primary.desc: Allows you to use a stolen 4th Job Explorer skill
Leap backwards while throwing cards that explode and debuffs enemies hit
details: [Debuff]: Attacks towards this enemy have increased %Ignore DEF
[Passive]: Permanently increases %Damage of

primary.desc: Creates an expanding tornado of cards that deals damage to enemies within it
details: All attacks from Tempest are critical hits
You may move while casting
Increases %Weapon Mastery provided
Now grants flat Attack and increases %Crit Damage and %Final Damage

primary.desc: Steals the buffs of nearby enemies, if more than one is stolen, the most powerful is applied
details:
If the buff stolen was:
  • [Attack Increasing]: You gain increased Attack
  • [Damage Ignoring]: You gain increased %Damage Reduction
  • [Damage Reflecting]: You reflect back a portion of damage received
  • [Invincibility]: You become temporarily invincible

primary.desc: Removes certain abnormal status effects and become immune to Abnormal Status for a few seconds

hyperActive.desc: Allows you to use a stolen Explorer Hyper Skill
Cards rain from above leaving a damaging field of cards

fifthMain.name: Luck of the Draw
fifthMain.shortDesc:
MP Cost: 1000, Duration: 7 sec, Damage: 465%, Number of Attacks: 1, Damage Taken during skill: -15%, Luck of the Draw does not trigger Carte Blanc and Carte Noir.
On ending, draws a card to buff all party members for 30 sec. Invincible while drawing.
Red Cross - Increases Recovers 2% Max HP/MP over time
Tree of Life - All Damage Taken: -7%, Abnormal Status Resistance: +22
Hourglass - Active Cooldowns shortened by 28% (except skills that ignore cooldown resets)
Three Swords - Final Damage +5%
rescent Moon - Gain all card buffs simultaneously.
Cooldown: 150 sec
fifthMain.desc: Throws a flurry of cards towards one enemy
details: You take reduced damage while this skill is active
Will not trigger

At the end of the skill, you will draw a card that buffs all party members:
  • [Red Cross]: Recovers %HP/MP over time
  • [Tree of Life]: Increases %Damage Reduction (including %Max HP attacks) and Abnormal Status Resistance
  • [Hourglass]: Reduces active cooldowns by 20% (except 5th Job skills & skills that ignore cooldown resets)
  • [Three Swords]: Increases %Final Damage
  • [Crescent Moon]: Gain all buffs simultaneously
  • You are invincible while drawing the card

fifthMain.name: Ace in the Hole
fifthMain.shortDesc: MP Cost: 800, Ricochets 20 times dealing 800% damage, before releasing the energy stored inside to strike up to 12 enemies for 1200% damage 12 times.\nAttack the enemies with the highest HP first, except the previously attacked enemies when it ricochets. If there are no enemies nearby, the card's magic is unleashed instantly.\nCooldown: 15 sec
fifthMain.desc: Creates a card that bounces around before unleashing a final attack

fifthMain.name: Phantom's Mark
fifthMain.shortDesc:
MP Cost: 1000. Requires 7 Master Thief Marks, if there is no enemy already marked as a target. Uses all Master Thief Marks upon skill activation.
Invincible for 2 sec after moving.
Activates a trajectory 7 time(s) dealing 600% damage 6 time(s) and complete the Master Thief Mark, activating 2 times and dealing 960% damage 15 time(s). For all attacks, Max Enemies Hit: 10, Additional Critical Rate: +100%
Enemies hit with a Cane skill or Tempest get a debuff for 30 sec. Targets the enemy with 7 stacks. Mille Aiguilles, Tempest, and Rift Break must hit targets 7 times more than other skills to mark an enemy or earn Master Thief Marks.
 Cooldown: 30 sec
fifthMain.desc: Cane skill attacks mark enemies with the stacking 'Master Thief Mark' debuff. Using this skill will teleport behind the target with the most stacks
details: If there are no enemies marked, the enemy with the highed Max HP will be targeted
All hits from this skill are critical hits

fifthMain.name: Rift Break
fifthMain.shortDesc: MP Cost: 1000, Max Enemies Hit: 10, Damage: 800%, Number of Attacks: 7, Max Chase Cut or Teleport: 7\nCooldown: 30 sec, cooldown is reduced by 3.5 sec per remaining teleports
fifthMain.desc: Instantly teleports to enemies and damages surrounding enemies at that location
details:
Up to 7 teleports will be activated
  • Pressing the Skill Key early will stop the attack and reduce the cooldown based on how many teleports remain

You can direct where the teleport will go by using the Arrow Keys
  • Pressing the Down Arrow Key will teleport you to the furthest enemy in range
Unaffected by Damage Reflect

meta: Phantom is LUK thief class part of the Heroes class group. What makes Phantoms unique is their ability to steal and use the Skills Explorer classes except for Zen/Jett
